intro: Platymiscium piliferum, commonly known as the hairy flat-leaf tree, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, hairy texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, round fruits. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated for landscaping and conservation purposes.
